issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Web services should allow for use of absolute uri in http request line

status.description: This issue is undergoing QA.  See linked QA issue(s) for progress.
status.name: In QA

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A fix has been committed, and will be part of the next release
status.name: Release Pending

fields.description: I am getting very strange errors when using aws-sdk-go with multipart. It seems the first attempt returns a {{No such property: uploads}} error, and then makes a second attempt, but adds a second {{X-Amz-Date}} header with capitalization, resulting in a {{403 Forbidden}} error. Unfortunately I do not have a good working example as this is part of a third party application. I have it set to V2 authentication, and that appears to be the case looking at the header, but not sure why I am getting a signature mismatch error. First attempt: {noformat} POST /mybucket1?uploads= HTTP/1.1 Host: objectstorage.mydomain.com:80 User-Agent: aws-sdk-go/1.4.18 (go1.7.3; linux; amd64) S3Manager Content-Length: 0 Authorization: AWS AKIAARXNL5N5QRXYNGOR:EDDynVbpiCo9JEajrpGWz7gLogM= x-amz-date: Fri, 03 Feb 2017 19:34:14 UTC Accept-Encoding: gzip Connection: close HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error Content-Type: text/xml; charset=UTF-8 Content-Length: 270 Connection: close Date: Fri, 03 Feb 2017 19:34:14 UTC Server: Eucalyptus/4.3.0 UNKNOWNNo such property: uploads for class: com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.msgs.InitiateMultipartUploadType52dff915-6aa5-4060-b0b6-5b3a86acbdad {noformat} Second attempt: {noformat} POST /mybucket1?uploads= HTTP/1.1 Host: objectstorage.mydomain.com:80 User-Agent: aws-sdk-go/1.4.18 (go1.7.3; linux; amd64) S3Manager Content-Length: 0 Authorization: AWS AKIAARXNL5N5QRXYNGOR:ALbNqOl4GDv8aGQnxUFiDNNIF5U= X-Amz-Date: Fri, 03 Feb 2017 19:34:14 UTC x-amz-date: Fri, 03 Feb 2017 19:34:14 UTC Accept-Encoding: gzip Connection: close HTTP/1.1 403 Forbidden Content-Type: text/xml; charset=UTF-8 Content-Length: 422 Connection: close Date: Fri, 03 Feb 2017 19:34:14 UTC Server: Eucalyptus/4.3.0 SignatureDoesNotMatchThe request signature we calculated does not match the signature you provided.POST x-amz-date:Fri, 03 Feb 2017 19:34:14 UTC /pcf-opsmanstack-ohumthi37ru-pcfopsmanagers3bucket-pybjyh8f0oscl/e92089c8-6e12-44fd-b4a2-c4801531eb39?uploads7bd82db4-4cd5-4456-89f8-514159c0bd9b {noformat} What is even more odd, is there are no errors in either the CLC or UFS pertaining to this transaction.
fields.summary: S3 errors when using aws-sdk-go and multipart upload

comments.body:
Verified using the methods mentioned above.

{code}
# s3cli -c config.json put tempfile90mb tempfile90mb
2017/04/13 11:34:56 Successfully uploaded file to http://10.111.5.85:8773/services/objectstorage/testbucket/tempfile90mb
